description:
As a game developer, I want to audit my game's economy and difficulty balance so I can catch design issues before they become code problems.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Running /game:balance-check reads planning docs and/or code
- Applies 8 economy anti-pattern checks from balance.md
- Applies 4 validation gates in order
- Scores difficulty curve if difficulty design exists
- Optional --report flag saves audit to docs/planning/
- Output includes specific fix recommendations for each issue found

title: Create balance-check command

- Scan for planning docs (brainstorm, menu-plan, beads with economy/balance tags)

title: Create game-implementation skill
description:
First cook-phase skill — proves implementation guidance works.

- Create skills/game-implementation/SKILL.md
- Frontmatter targeting cook-phase keywords:
  'implementing game code', 'coding game mechanics', 'building game loop',
  'setting up state machine', 'game architecture during development'
- Prescriptive content for 6 areas:
  1. Game Loop Setup — fixed update + variable render, accumulator pattern
  2. State Management — enum+switch, upgrade to FSM when states > 4
  3. Input Handling — action mapping layer from day 1
  4. Frame Budget — measure before optimizing, no per-frame allocations
  5. Entity Architecture — composition first, ECS when entity count > ~100
  6. Delta Time — every movement value * delta, speed in units-per-second
- Distill FROM game-architecture-audit, reframe as 'how to build' not 'what to check'
